headline: Top DeSantis megadonor doesnt appreciate him targeting Disney
author: Skyler Swisher
sentences:
It can be portrayed, or feel, or look like retaliation.?
Griffin said DeSantis has done a lot of things right,? and he agreed with DeSantis stance on HB 1557, which prohibits classroom instruction on sexual orientation or gender identity? for grades kindergarten through third or in a manner deemed not age appropriate.?
But Griffin told the conference he thinks DeSantis should think about his messaging? directed at Disney.

Ken Griffin, CEO of the Citadel hedge fund and a GOP megadonor, said he didnt appreciate? DeSantis going after Disneys status in Florida law after the corporation spoke out against HB 1557, officially titled Parental Rights in Education but known by critics as the dont say gay? law.

Ron DeSantis top financial backers says he disagrees with Floridas move to eliminate Disney Worlds special government district, cautioning politicians to stay above the fray? when it comes to retaliating against corporate America.

Griffin also broke with DeSantis in October over the governors opposition to county-level mask mandates, telling the Economic Club of Chicago that each county should have been free to decide whether to require face coverings.
Griffin shared his view Monday during a discussion at the Milken Institute Global Conference in Beverly Hills, California, which was first reported by Forbes.
Its important that our leaders from both parties stay above the fray when it comes to the concept of retaliation against corporate America,? he said.
2 individual Republican donor nationally ahead of the midterm elections, according to OpenSecrets, a nonpartisan group that tracks money in politics.
Griffin has given nearly $10.8 million to DeSantis political committee, making him the governors top individual political donor.
DeSantis has said the legislation was designed to eliminate special treatment in Florida law that no other theme park receives.

The district allows Disney to act as its own government over its theme park and resort properties in Central Florida.
Griffin said he hasnt decided on who hes backing for president in 2024, but he says he will keep watching? DeSantis.
DeSantis signed legislation on April 22 abolishing Disneys Reedy Creek Improvement District on June 1, 2023.
DeSantis has raised unprecedented sums of cash for his reelection effort, passing $100 million in April.
He last donated to DeSantis political committee in April 2021, giving $5 million.
